descriptions: The Fool: A carefree traveler, representing new beginnings, spontaneity, and a leap of faith.
The Magician: A figure harnessing the elements, symbolizing manifestation, resourcefulness, and potential.
The High Priestess: A mysterious woman between two pillars, embodying intuition, subconscious knowledge, and mystery.
The Empress: A nurturing figure surrounded by nature, representing fertility, abundance, and maternal care.
The Emperor: A powerful ruler on a throne, symbolizing authority, structure, and stability.
The Hierophant: A spiritual teacher with followers, representing tradition, spiritual wisdom, and conformity.
The Lovers: A couple under an angel’s blessing, symbolizing love, union, and choices.
The Chariot: A determined figure in a chariot, signifying control, willpower, and triumph over obstacles.
Strength: A woman gently holding a lion, representing courage, inner strength, and compassion.
The Hermit: A solitary figure with a lantern, symbolizing introspection, solitude, and inner guidance.
Wheel of Fortune: A wheel surrounded by various figures, representing fate, cycles, and change.
Justice: A figure with a sword and scales, embodying fairness, truth, and accountability.
The Hanged Man: A man suspended upside down, representing surrender, perspective, and sacrifice.
Death: A skeletal figure on a horse, symbolizing transformation, endings, and new beginnings.
Temperance: An angel mixing two cups, representing balance, moderation, and harmony.
The Devil: A figure with chains and a goat, symbolizing temptation, materialism, and bondage.
The Tower: A tower struck by lightning, representing upheaval, chaos, and revelation.
The Star: A woman pouring water under the stars, symbolizing hope, inspiration, and serenity.
The Moon: A night scene with a path and animals, representing intuition, illusion, and the subconscious.
The Sun: A bright sun with joyful figures, embodying positivity, success, and vitality.
Judgment: Angels calling forth the dead, representing renewal, reflection, and awakening.
The World: A figure within a wreath, symbolizing completion, fulfillment, and unity.
Ace of Wands: A hand holding a budding wand, symbolizing inspiration, new ideas, and potential.
Two of Wands: A figure holding the world, representing planning, exploration, and future prospects.
Three of Wands: A figure looking out to sea, symbolizing foresight, expansion, and trade.
Four of Wands: Celebration under a garland, representing harmony, homecoming, and stability.
Five of Wands: Competing figures, symbolizing conflict, competition, and challenges.
Six of Wands: A victorious figure on a horse, representing triumph, recognition, and success.
Seven of Wands: A figure defending a position, symbolizing perseverance, challenge, and standing one’s ground.
Eight of Wands: Eight wands flying through the air, representing speed, action, and rapid progress.
Nine of Wands: A weary figure with a bandaged head, symbolizing resilience, persistence, and defensiveness.
Ten of Wands: A figure burdened with wands, representing responsibility, stress, and hard work.
Page of Wands: A youthful figure holding a wand, symbolizing enthusiasm, exploration, and creativity.
Knight of Wands: A knight on a horse, representing adventure, impulsiveness, and passion.
Queen of Wands: A confident queen with a sunflower, embodying charisma, determination, and warmth.
King of Wands: A king with a wand and a lion, symbolizing leadership, vision, and courage.
Ace of Cups: A cup overflowing with water, symbolizing love, emotions, and new relationships.
Two of Cups: Two figures exchanging cups, representing partnership, unity, and attraction.
Three of Cups: Three figures celebrating, symbolizing friendship, joy, and community.
Four of Cups: A figure contemplating three cups, representing apathy, reevaluation, and contemplation.
Five of Cups: A figure mourning spilled cups, symbolizing loss, regret, and focusing on the negative.
Six of Cups: Children exchanging cups, representing nostalgia, memories, and innocence.
Seven of Cups: A figure faced with various cups, symbolizing choices, fantasies, and illusions.
Eight of Cups: A figure walking away from cups, representing withdrawal, moving on, and seeking deeper meaning.
Nine of Cups: A figure content with cups, symbolizing wishes fulfilled, satisfaction, and emotional well-being.
Ten of Cups: A family under a rainbow, representing harmony, happiness, and fulfillment in relationships.
Page of Cups: A youthful figure with a cup, symbolizing creativity, intuition, and new emotional experiences.
Knight of Cups: A romantic knight, representing idealism, charm, and pursuing dreams.
Queen of Cups: A nurturing queen holding a cup, embodying empathy, intuition, and compassion.
King of Cups: A king with a cup, symbolizing emotional balance, wisdom, and diplomacy.
Ace of Swords: A sword held high, symbolizing clarity, truth, and new ideas.
Two of Swords: A blindfolded figure with crossed swords, representing indecision, stalemate, and choices.
Three of Swords: A heart pierced by three swords, symbolizing heartbreak, grief, and sorrow.
Four of Swords: A resting figure, representing contemplation, rest, and recovery.
Five of Swords: A figure with swords in hand, symbolizing conflict, defeat, and hollow victories.
Six of Swords: A boat moving away from choppy waters, representing transition, healing, and journey.
Seven of Swords: A figure sneaking away with swords, symbolizing deception, strategy, and betrayal.
Eight of Swords: A bound figure surrounded by swords, representing restriction, confusion, and feeling trapped.
Nine of Swords: A figure awake at night, symbolizing anxiety, worry, and fear.
Ten of Swords: A figure lying with ten swords, representing betrayal, endings, and loss.
Page of Swords: A youthful figure with a sword, symbolizing curiosity, communication, and vigilance.
Knight of Swords: A knight charging ahead, representing action, determination, and impulsiveness.
Queen of Swords: A queen with a sword and a stern expression, embodying clarity, independence, and intellect.
King of Swords: A king with a sword, symbolizing authority, rationality, and truth.
Ace of Pentacles: A hand holding a pentacle, symbolizing new financial opportunities and material beginnings.
Two of Pentacles: A figure juggling two pentacles, representing balance, adaptability, and multitasking.
Three of Pentacles: Figures collaborating on a project, symbolizing teamwork, skill, and mastery.
Four of Pentacles: A figure holding onto pentacles, representing stability, control, and possessiveness.
Five of Pentacles: Two figures in the cold, symbolizing hardship, financial loss, and struggle.
Six of Pentacles: A figure giving to others, representing generosity, charity, and balance in giving and receiving.
Seven of Pentacles: A figure assessing pentacles, symbolizing patience, investment, and contemplation of progress.
Eight of Pentacles: A figure diligently working on pentacles, representing craftsmanship, skill development, and hard work.
Nine of Pentacles: A figure enjoying luxury, symbolizing independence, self-sufficiency, and rewards of hard work.
Ten of Pentacles: A family surrounded by pentacles, representing legacy, wealth, and long-term success.
Page of Pentacles: A young figure with a pentacle, symbolizing ambition, new opportunities, and practicality.
Knight of Pentacles: A knight on a slow-moving horse, representing reliability, hard work, and perseverance.
Queen of Pentacles: A nurturing queen surrounded by nature, embodying practicality, security, and domesticity.
King of Pentacles: A king with wealth and abundance, symbolizing stability, success, and financial mastery.
